name: Arsenicum Album
details:
A profoundly acting remedy on every organ and tissue. Its general symptoms often lead to its successful application. 
Among these all-prevailing debility, exhaustion and restlessness with nightly aggravation are most important.
Great exaustion after slightest exertion. This, with the peculiar irritability of fibre, gives the characteristic irritable weakness.
Burning pains. Unquenchable thirst. Burning relieved by heat. Seaside complaints. 
Injurious effects of fruits, especially more watery ones. Gives quite and ease to the last moments of life when given in high potency.
Fear fright and worry. Green discharges. Infantile Kala-azar.

This remedy should be thought of in ailments from alcoholism, ptomaine poisoning, stings, dissecting wounds, chewing tobacco; 
ill effects from decayed food or animal matter; odor of discharches is putrid; in complaints that return annually.
Anemia and chlorosis. Degenerative changes. Gradual loss of weight from impaired nutrition.
Reduces refractive index of blood serum. Maintains the system under the stress of malignancy regardless of location.
Malarial cachexia. Septic infections and low vitality.
dosage: Third to thirtieth potency. The very highest potencies often yield brilliant results.

Head: Head is in constant motion.
Delirium tremens; cursing and raving; vicious.
Periodical burning pains, with restlessness; with cold skin.
Hemicrania, with icy feeling of scalp and great weakness.
Scalp very sensitive; cannot brush hair.
Scalp itches intolerably; circular patches of bare spots; rough, dirty, sensitive, and covered with dry scales; nightly burning and itching; dandruff.
Sensitive head in open air.
Headaches relieved by cold, other symptoms worse.
Mind: Thinks it is useless to take medicine.
Fears, of death, of being left alone.
Despair drives him from place to place.
General sensibility increased, sensitive to disorder and confusion.
Eyes: Ciliary neuralgia, with fine burning pain.
External inflammation, with extreme pain; burning, hot, and excoriating lachrymation.
Burning in eyes, with acrid lachrymation.
Ears: Roaring in ears, during a paroxysm of pain.
Nose: Hay-fever and coryza; worse in open air; better indoors.
Face: Swollen, pale, yellow, cachectic, sunken, cold, and covered with sweat.
Mouth: Neuralgia of teeth; feel long and very sore; worse after midnight; better with warmth.
Tongue dry, clean and red; stitching and burning pain in tongue, ulcerated with blue color.
Ulceration of mouth with dryness and burning heat.
Throat: Diphtheritic membrane looks dry and wrinkled.
Swollen, edematous, constricted, burning, unable to swallow.
Stomach: Stomach extremely irritable; seems raw; as if torn.
Everything swallowed seems to lodge in the esophagus, which seems as if closed and nothing would pass.
Great thirst; drinks much, but little at a time.
Nausea, retching, vomiting, after eating or drinking.
Ill effects of vegetable diet, melons and watery fruits generally.
Cannot bear the sight or smell of food.
Vomiting of blood, bile, green mucus, or brown-black mixed with blood.
Heartburn; gulping up of acid and bitter substances which seem to excoriate the throat.
Gastralgia from slightest food or dring.
Dyspepsia from vinegar, acids, ice-cream, ice-water, tobacco.
Terrible fear and dyspnea, with gastralgia; also faintness, icy coldness, great exhaustion.
Abdomen: Gnawing, burning pains like coals of fire; relieved by heat.
Liver and spleen enlarged and painful.
Pain as from wound in abdomen on coughing.
Rectum: Burning pain and pressure in rectum and anus.
Stool: Small, offensive, dark, with much prostration.
Hemorrhoids burn like fire; relieved by heat.
Worse at night, and after eating an drinking; from chilling stomach, alcoholic abuse, spoiled meat.
Cholera with intense agony, prostration and burning thirst.
Urine: After urinating, feeling of weakness in abdomen.
Epithelial cells; cylindrical clots of fibrin and globules of pus and blood.
Female: Pain as if from red-hot wires; worse least exertion; causes great fatigue; better in warm room.
Stitching pain in pelvis extending down the thigh.
Menses too profuse and too soon.
Respiratory: Unable to lie down; fears suffocation.
Cought worse after midnight; worse lying on back.
Hemoptysis with pain between shoulders; burning heat all over.
Darting pain through upper third of right lung.
Cough dry, as from sulphur fumes; after drinking.
Heart: Angina pectoris, with pain in neck and occiput.
Irritable heart in smokers and tobacco chewers.
Extremeties: Paralysis of lower limbs with atrophy.
Trembling, twitching, spasms, weakness, heaviness, uneasiness.
Skin: Itching, burning, swellings; edema, eruption, papular, dry, rough, scaly; worse with cold and scratching.
Sleep: Must have head raised by pillows.
Dreams are full of care and feat.
Modalities: Worse: wet weather, after midnight; from cold, cold drinks, or food.
Better: from heat; head elevated; warm drinks.
